description: Clump paper birch (Betula papyrifera 'clump') is an amazing tree species. It is a native tree of northern North America, and it prefers moist, acidic soil. Its beautiful, paper-like bark and bright white trunk, make it a favorite ornamental and shade tree. Clump paper birch is also a great choice for erosion control, due to its short, wide spread. Its leaves turn a vibrant, golden yellow in the fall, adding stunning autumn color to any landscape. Its easy to grow, and very tolerant of urban conditions and windy sites. Clump paper birch is an ideal tree for anyone looking for a great ornamental tree with a wonderful, elegant shape.
